perturbation.original_text: During the Term and subject to the limitations set forth in this Agreement, Naked shall have an exclusive right and license in the Territory to use Athlete's name, nickname, initials, autograph, image, likeness, photographs, biographical details, facsimile signature, voice, videos, electronic media depictions, any words, symbols or other depictions, as well as any other identifying attributes that would identify Athlete to the public, including any trade mark(s), copyrights which Wade has, as set forth on Schedule A attached hereto, and all multimedia assets that Wade owns or has right to use (collectively, the "Wade Image") solely for the advertising, endorsement, promotion, or sale of the Naked Products (including the Wade Products) in the Territory as follows:
perturbation.changed_text: During the Term and subject to the limitations set forth in this Agreement, Naked shall have a non-exclusive right and license in the Territory to use Athlete's name, nickname, initials, autograph, image, likeness, photographs, biographical details, facsimile signature, voice, videos, electronic media depictions, any words, symbols or other depictions, as well as any other identifying attributes that would identify Athlete to the public, including any trade mark(s), copyrights which Wade has, as set forth on Schedule A attached hereto, and all multimedia assets that Wade owns or has right to use (collectively, the "Wade Image") solely for the advertising, endorsement, promotion, or sale of the Naked Products (including the Wade Products) in the Territory as follows:
perturbation.explanation: Changing "exclusive" to "non-exclusive" contradicts the initial intent of granting Naked Brand Group exclusive rights to Wade's image for the specified products, undermining trademark protection and the value of the endorsement deal. This modification creates uncertainty regarding the extent of Naked's brand protection and the exclusivity Wade is providing.

perturbation.original_text:
Royalties. As consideration for Wade's services under this Agreement, Naked will pay Wade royalties as follows:

A. Royalties. Naked will report, and Wade will be paid, royalty payments at [***]
perturbation.changed_text:
Royalties. As consideration for Wade's services under this Agreement, Naked may, at its sole discretion, pay Wade royalties as follows:

A. Royalties. Naked will report, and Wade may be paid, royalty payments at [***]
perturbation.explanation: Changing "will pay" to "may pay" makes the payment of royalties discretionary. This contradicts the fundamental understanding of a royalty agreement, where payment is typically an obligation, not an option. It introduces uncertainty and could be interpreted as a breach of contract, especially under New York law, which governs this agreement (Section 25).
perturbation.contradicted_law: Contract Law, New York State Law

perturbation.original_text: The decision of the arbitrator will be final and binding on the parties and any award of the arbitrator may be entered in any court of competent jurisdiction.
perturbation.changed_text: The decision of the arbitrator will be considered advisory and non-binding on the parties, and any award of the arbitrator may be used as a suggestion in any court of competent jurisdiction.
perturbation.explanation: By changing the decision from "final and binding" to "advisory and non-binding," the clause now fundamentally undermines the purpose of arbitration, which is to provide a conclusive resolution to disputes. This contradicts the essence of an arbitration agreement, as it renders the outcome non-enforceable. Parties usually agree to binding arbitration to avoid litigation.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Federal Arbitration Act, New York Civil Practice Law and Rules
